alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SUFFOLK COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 139 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles northeast of Calverton, or 7 miles northeast of Wading River, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Riverhead, Southold, Mattituck, Southampton, Westhampton, Sag Harbor, Bridgehampton, Noyack, Shelter Island, Greenport, Shinnecock Hills, East Hampton, Peconic, Hampton Bays, and East Quogue. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
